member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE
member.summary: Indicates whether or how a property can be indexed.

member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_NONE
member.summary: Never generate any index on this property.

member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISK
member.summary: Always build the individual value index, but build the vector index only on demand.

member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDEMAND
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Build the individual value index or vector index the first time the index is used in a query to filter, group, or sort. After being generated the first time, the index is maintained for future queries. Most property indexes should be built on demand, because building and maintaining indexes is expensive and they should be built only if they will be used.

member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISKALL
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Always build both the individual value index and the vector index.

member.name: PROPDESC_COLUMNINDEX_TYPE.PDCIT_ONDISKVECTOR
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Always build the vector index, but build the value index only on demand.
